casebody.data:
W. LAWSON KING v. MONTGOMERY COUNTY, MARYLAND [No. 90,

September Term, 1982.]

Decided January 6, 1983.

The cause was argued before Murphy, C. J., and Smith, Eldridge, Cole, Davidson, Rodowsky and Couch, JJ.

R. Edwin Brown, with whom were John R. Clapp and Brown & Sturm on the brief, for appellant. Stephen P. Elmendorf, Assistant County Attorney, with whom were Paul A. McGuckian, County Attorney, Robert G. Tobin, Jr., Deputy County Attorney, and Nathan J. Greenbaum, Assistant County Attorney, on the brief, for appellee. Per Curiam:

For reasons stated in the opinion of Judge Philip M. Fairbanks, of the Circuit Court for Montgomery County, filed March 31, 1982, in the case of Montgomery County, Maryland v. W. Lawson King et al., Petition No. 254, the denial of the injunction is hereby affirmed.

Judgment affirmed with costs.
